title: Why is the Buckingham Nix album not on any streaming services? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, the distribution of music, at least in the U.S. (not sure about other countries, but I know this is how it is in my country), is governed through policies dictated by “fair use”. Basically, if the label doesn’t give direct permission to stream the recording, then it cannot be streamed. Just like, when a singer samples another song, per copyright law, the singer has to get permission to use the sample from the other artist’s song. Thanks for reading this short and sweet answer on Quora.
I’m not completely sure, other than the album itself has been out of print for decades. It’s a killer record, and vinyl copies are available, but they’re expensive.
